title: Did Theodore Roosevelt ‘Punish’ a Mississippi City for Forcing Out a Black Postmaster?
subtitle: The president retaliated when Minnie Cox was pushed out of her position by white residents of Indianola.
author: Arturo Garcia
vclaim: Theodore Roosevelt closed the post office in Indianola, Mississippi, in 1903 and rerouted local mail after townspeople forced local postmaster Minnie Cox out because she was black.
